about.description:
Postgres-XL (eXtensible Lattice) allows you to either partition tables across multiple nodes,
or replicate them. Partitioning (or distributing) tables allows for write scalability across
multiple nodes as well as massively parallel processing (MPP) for Big Data type of workloads.
about.summary: [conflicts with postgresql] Postgres-XL is an all-purpose fully ACID open source scale-out SQL database solution.

name: postgres-xl
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "9.5r1.6" %}

package:
  name: postgres-xl
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://www.postgres-xl.org/downloads/postgres-xl-{{version}}.tar.bz2
  sha256: 0dab9c2b6c749161ce56ccdef8e7bfc80c607a30c55e0089ec50c7d05af5fa97
  patches:
    - 00-disable-failed-contrib.patch

build:
  skip: True  # [win or osx]
  number: 3

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
  host:
    - bison
    - flex
    - openssl
    - readline  # [not win]
    - zlib
    - krb5  # [not osx]
    - libxml2
    - libxslt
    - libuuid  # [not win]
  run:
    - openssl
    - readline  # [not win]
    - zlib
    - krb5  # [not osx]
    - libxml2
    - libxslt
    - libuuid  # [not win]

test:
  commands:
    - pg_config
    - pg_ctl --help
    - postgres --help
    - pgxc_ctl --help
    - pgxc_monitor --help
    - gtm --help
    - gtm_ctl --help
    - gtm_proxy --help
    - conda inspect linkages $PKG_NAME  # [not win]
    - conda inspect objects $PKG_NAME  # [osx]

about:
  home: https://www.postgres-xl.org/
  license: PostgreSQL
  license_file: COPYRIGHT
  summary: '[conflicts with postgresql] Postgres-XL is an all-purpose fully ACID open source scale-out SQL database solution.'

  description: |
      Postgres-XL (eXtensible Lattice) allows you to either partition tables across multiple nodes,
      or replicate them. Partitioning (or distributing) tables allows for write scalability across
      multiple nodes as well as massively parallel processing (MPP) for Big Data type of workloads.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - sodre
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.6.15
